definition: to prostitute oneself/to sell oneself into slavery
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: Zhaoqing visit old tin work, say to want to buy back his'll, send him back to the tangshan.
sentences.chinese: 肇慶探望老錫工，說要買回他的賣身契，送他回唐山。

sentences.english: She had to sign an indenture to sell herself, because she owed money to the landlord .
sentences.chinese: 由於欠地主家的錢，她不得已簽了賣身契。

sentences.english: The police had sold themselves to the gang leaders.
sentences.chinese: 那些警察已賣身投靠匪首。

sentences.english: I would like for you to prostitution , can you?
sentences.chinese: 我願意爲你去賣身，可以吧？

sentences.english: He committed suicide rather than sell himself to the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 他寧願自殺而不願賣身投靠敵人。
男人可以去乞食，女人就得去賣身。

sentences.english: The Union leaders were accused of selling out to the employers.
sentences.chinese: 工會領導人被指責賣身投靠僱主。

sentences.english: He sells himself to Fu Shan as a slave to give them a decent burial.
sentences.chinese: 董永爲了安葬父母，賣身給傅善爲奴。

sentences.english: In order to bury my father, I have to sell myself.
sentences.chinese: 爲求葬老爹，唯有賣身爲奴自作賤。
做賣身的奴工，你考慮嗎？

sentences.english: She was some peasant girl, doubtless, whom her parents had sold into slavery.
sentences.chinese: 她肯定是個農村姑娘，父母把她賣身爲奴。

sentences.english: If I was the mother I would not want my daughter to sell her body.
sentences.chinese: 如果我是這個媽媽，我絕對不會讓自己的女兒去賣身。

sentences.english: I won't sell my freedom for slavery.
sentences.chinese: 我決不把自己賣身爲奴隸。

definition: (of a slave or servant) to be given one's freedom/(of a prostitute) to marry and leave one's trade
to work as a good-time girl/to prostitute oneself
silver currency/currency of the Qing dynasty based on the silver tael 兩|两
to lose money instead of being paid (i.e. sb should pay me, but is actually taking my money)
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
to lift sth up/to elevate sb/to honor sb (with compliments, gifts, promotions etc)/to show great regard/to speak highly/Taiwan pr. [tai2 ju3]
"sensational headline writers", people who write misleading titles in order to generate clicks from Internet users/clickbait
